payload.name: mechanistic
payload.core: Explain and predict system behavior by identifying constituent parts, their properties, and how they interact. Reveals intervention points and failure modes by understanding internal structure rather than just input-output correlations.
proc: Decompose system into constituent parts with defined boundaries
Identify properties and capacities of each component
Map interactions: what triggers what, through which interface
Trace causal chain from input through components to output
Identify critical dependencies and single points of failure
Validate mechanism against known behavior; check edge cases
Derive intervention points: where can chain be modified
check: All components named with clear boundaries
Interaction types specified (chemical, electrical, logical, etc.)
Causal chain traceable end-to-end without gaps
At least one intervention point identified
Mechanism validated against at least one known outcome

diff.causal-inference: Causal inference = statistical estimation of causal effects; Mechanistic = internal structure explanation
diff.systems-thinking: Systems = emergent behavior from component interactions over time; Mechanistic = how each component works inside
diff.diagnostic: Diagnostic uses mechanistic models to localize faults; Mechanistic builds the models
diff.counterfactual: Counterfactual = what-if queries; Mechanistic = why it works that way

fail.mode: Just-so mechanisms: plausible-sounding stories without validation
fail.signal: Mechanism not tested against edge cases or novel conditions; no falsifiable predictions
mit: Require at least one validated prediction from mechanism
Identify assumptions that could break the mechanism
Test mechanism against failure cases, not just success cases
Distinguish known vs hypothesized component behavior

use: Engineering: circuit design, software architecture, failure analysis
Debugging: tracing root cause through component chain
Safety analysis: identifying failure modes and cascades
Biology/medicine: drug mechanism of action, disease pathways
System design: ensuring components interact correctly

rel.name: diagnostic
rel.note: uses mechanistic models to localize faults

ex.problem: Why does the service timeout under load?
ex.mechanism: Each backend holds DB connection for request duration. At >10 concurrent requests per backend, DB pool exhausted, new requests block waiting for connection.
ex.intervention: Add connection pooling with timeout, or increase DB max connections
ex.validation: Reproduces at 100+ concurrent requests; resolved by connection pool
